name: Colombo Day Tour
description: A short city tour to explore Colombo’s history, culture and modern lifestyle.
highlights: Gangaramaya Temple and Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya
Experience modern Sri Lankan city lifestyle
Old Parliament building and the Lotus Tower
Pettah Market and the Red Mosque

itinerary.description:
Colombo, the bustling capital of Sri Lanka, is the main gateway for travelers exploring the island’s southern beaches.

The city has a rich history, influenced by the Portuguese, Dutch, and British, and shows this heritage through colonial buildings alongside modern skyscrapers and shopping centers.

During the tour, you will visit the Gangaramaya Temple and Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya, see the Old Parliament building and the Lotus Tower, and explore Pettah Market and the Red Mosque.

Colombo also offers entertainment such as theaters, cinemas, cafes, museums, and art galleries. This short tour gives you a good overview of the city’s culture, history, and everyday life.

name: Kandy Day Tour
description: A full day tour to explore Kandy’s culture, wildlife, and gardens.

itinerary.description:
The Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage was established in 1975 to care for adult and orphaned elephants in difficult situations. It is the largest breeding center for wild Asian elephants in the world. Here, you will see how the elephants are cared for, fed, and taken to the river for bathing.

If you prefer, the Pinnawala Nursery can be replaced by the Millennium Nursery, a smaller facility supervised by volunteers. You can take a short elephant ride, visit a small museum about elephants, and even participate in bathing an elephant in the river.

Next, visit a garden of Ayurveda and spices, where you will learn about medicinal plants and enjoy aromatic spiced tea.

Then, you will visit a working tea factory to see how the famous Ceylon tea is made, learn to identify different varieties, and taste the tea.

Afterward, explore the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya. Covering about 60 hectares, the garden has tropical flowers, herbs, shrubs, and trees, including trees planted by world figures like Gagarin and Tsar Nikolai II. Walk among giant bamboo thickets, orchids, hibiscus, Seychelles palms, and many other tropical plants.

Finally, visit Sri Dalada Maligawa, the main temple of the island, which houses the sacred Tooth Relic of the Buddha.

This tour is ideal for nature lovers, wildlife enthusiasts, people who enjoy active walks, and those interested in culture and religion.

name: Galle Day Tour
description: A short tour to explore Galle’s river, wildlife, history, and cultural sites.

itinerary.description:
This excursion is designed for those who prefer to stay close to the coast. Begin with a boat ride on the Madu River, where you can observe the daily lives of local Sri Lankans, their traditional crafts, shrimp and fish catching techniques, and visit an island where world-famous Ceylon cinnamon is grown. You will also see local Buddhist temples, animals and birds, and dense mangrove thickets.

Next, visit one of the oldest turtle hatcheries along the coast at Kosgoda, opened in 1978. Staff patrol the shore for turtle eggs and transfer them to the farm to protect the sea turtle population. You will see newborn turtles as well as adult turtles that cannot survive in the open ocean. Rare albino turtles are also housed at the farm.

Then, visit a moonstone deposit to learn about the process of mining this precious stone.

Finally, explore the traditional mask museum, which showcases a large variety of masks, along with sculptures and paintings. You can see a workshop demonstrating step-by-step mask making, and learn the folklore and stories behind these traditional creations.

name: Ella Day Tour
description: A full-day tour to explore Ella’s scenic train ride, mountains, waterfalls, and baby elephants.
highlights: World Famous Train Ride to Ella

itinerary.description:
This tour gives you a glimpse of everything Sri Lanka is famous for in just one day: highlands and tea plantations, a scenic train ride, adorable baby elephants at a nursery, walks through agricultural gardens, and tropical fruits.

From your hotel or guesthouse, travel to Bandarawela station to board the train along the famous central railway line to Demodara station (approximately 50 minutes). Along the way, enjoy views of tea plantations and pass the iconic Nine Arch Bridge.

After reaching Demodara, continue to Ella and return to the Nine Arch Bridge to take photos and learn about its history.

Next, climb Little Adam's Peak to admire the stunning views of Ella and its surrounding mountains. Afterwards, visit the Elephant Transit Home nursery to see how baby elephants are fed with milk.

On the way back, stop at Ravana Falls, one of the most beautiful waterfalls on the island.

name: Mirissa Whale-Watching
description: A thrilling boat tour to see blue whales and dolphins off the coast of Mirissa.

itinerary.description:
Whale and dolphin watching in Mirissa is one of the most exciting water activities in Sri Lanka. Blue whales, the largest animals on earth, are often spotted here, making Mirissa the best place for this experience.

The tour usually takes 3–5 hours, with an average of 4 hours. Tours start before 7 a.m. from Mirissa Harbor, so you should arrive between 6:00 and 6:30 a.m. Morning tea is served before departure, and breakfast packages and snacks are available on board. The boat also has a toilet for your convenience.

name: Udawalawe Safari
description: A day safari to explore Udawalawe National Park and see elephants and wildlife up close.

itinerary.description:
Udawalawe National Park lies on the boundary of Sabaragamuwa and Uva Provinces in Sri Lanka. The park was created to provide a sanctuary for wild animals displaced by the construction of the Udawalawe Reservoir, as well as to protect the catchment of the reservoir.

The park is especially popular among elephant lovers, as it is home to more than 400 elephants. During your visit, it is common to see large herds of adult and baby elephants feeding, bathing, and playing in water. Besides elephants, you may also spot many birds, water buffaloes, deer, monkeys, and other wildlife.

The tour concludes with a visit to Mulkirigala Rock Monastery, a cluster of ancient Buddhist cave shrines on a natural rock rising 673 feet (205 meters) from the jungle floor. While temples have existed here for 2,000 years, the caves contain colorful Buddha statues and frescoes dating from the 1700s, making it one of South Sri Lanka’s must-see sites.

name: Yala Safari
description: A one-day safari to explore Yala National Park and visit the sacred temple in Kataragama.

itinerary.description:
The two main attractions in southeast Sri Lanka are Yala National Park, one of the oldest and largest nature reserves on the island, and the sacred temple in Kataragama. This tour is ideal for wildlife lovers and people interested in culture, religion, and traditions.

Yala is home to the endemic Ceylon leopard, which is the highlight most visitors hope to see. The park also has wild elephants, buffaloes, deer, wild boars, bears, peacocks, crocodiles, and many other birds and reptiles. The 4-hour safari allows you to experience the rich wildlife, depending on the skill of the jeep driver and a bit of luck.

After the safari, visit the main temple in Kataragama, a sacred site for both Buddhists and Hindus. According to legend, the Buddha meditated here during his third visit to the island, making it one of the 16 important pilgrimage sites in Sri Lanka. The temple is also dedicated to the Hindu god Skanda, where visitors can seek blessings for various life matters.

name: Ridiyagama Safari
description: A half-day safari to see exotic and endemic animals, visit a botanical garden, and explore Mulkirigala Rock Monastery.
highlights: Bata Ata State Agricultural Botanical Garden

itinerary.description:
Ridiyagama Safari Park offers a guaranteed chance to see a large number of exotic animals, unlike most national parks where wildlife sightings are unpredictable. The safari takes place in a huge, enclosed area where animals such as lions, Bengal tigers, elephants, ostriches, zebras, antelopes, and many birds live freely. Visitors explore the park in a latticed open jeep for a safe and close-up experience.

The safari lasts about 1.5–2 hours. Afterward, visit the Bata Ata State Agricultural Botanical Garden, which features fruit trees, shrubs, flowers (including endemic species), and walking paths. This garden also allows visitors to taste local traditional Sri Lankan dishes and herbal teas.

The tour ends with a visit to Mulkirigala Rock Monastery, a cluster of ancient Buddhist cave shrines rising 673 feet (205 meters) from the jungle floor. The caves contain colorful Buddha statues and frescoes dating back to the 1700s and have been a place of worship for over 2,000 years, making it one of South Sri Lanka’s must-see sites.

name: Bundala Safari
description: A one-day safari to explore wetlands, lagoons, and one of Sri Lanka’s best bird-watching national parks.

itinerary.description:
Bundala National Park, located in the southern part of Sri Lanka, is a wildlife enthusiast’s dream come true. The park spreads across 6,216 hectares and consists of wetlands, dry thorny forests, lagoons, and sand dunes, making it one of the country’s most ecologically rich national parks.

Bundala is internationally recognized for its extraordinary birdlife, hosting more than 200 species, including both resident and migratory birds. Some of the key species include flamingos, pelicans, spoonbills, storks, herons, and a wide variety of wading birds. The migratory season from September to March turns the park into a stunning spectacle as thousands of birds arrive to nest and feed.

In addition to birdlife, Bundala is also home to wildlife such as elephants, mugger crocodiles, spotted deer, wild boar, monitor lizards, and various small mammals. The safari drive allows visitors to experience these animals within their natural habitats while enjoying scenic lagoon views.

This one-day safari is perfect for nature photographers, bird lovers, and wildlife explorers looking for a peaceful and richly biodiverse adventure.

name: Udawalawe & Nuwara Eliya
description: A 2-day wildlife and hill country adventure featuring Udawalawe National Park, scenic train rides, waterfalls, and tea plantations.
highlights: Scenic train journey to Nuwara Eliya

itinerary.description:
Experience a captivating 2-day journey combining wildlife exploration and the serene hill country of Sri Lanka.

Start with a safari in Udawalawe National Park, home to elephants and diverse wildlife. Travel through lush landscapes, visit historic temples, waterfalls, and iconic railway bridges.

Continue into the cool, picturesque highlands of Nuwara Eliya with its tea estates, colonial architecture, and charming gardens.

itinerary.title: Udawalawe Safari & Ella Highlights
itinerary.description:
Begin your day with a morning jeep safari in Udawalawe National Park, spotting elephants and other wildlife in their natural habitats.

Continue towards Ella, stopping at Buduruwagala Temple with its ancient rock carvings and nearby scenic waterfalls.

Visit the famous Nine-Arch Bridge, then climb a small peak for panoramic views of the surrounding hills.

Overnight stay at your hotel in Ella.

itinerary.title: Train Journey & Nuwara Eliya Exploration
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, board the train at Ella Railway Station for one of the world’s most scenic rail journeys, passing tea plantations, waterfalls, and tunnels en route to Nanuoya.

In Nuwara Eliya, explore the historic post office, colonial-era mansions, and the Grand Hotel.

Visit a traditional tea factory to learn about Ceylon tea production and enjoy tastings.

Continue to Ramboda Waterfall and conclude with a climb up Ambuluwawa Tower for panoramic views over the surrounding landscape before returning to your hotel.

name: Nuwara Eliya & Ella
description: A 2-day hill country tour exploring Nuwara Eliya’s tea plantations, gardens, waterfalls, and the scenic landscapes of Ella.
highlights: Tea plantations and tea museum visit
Scenic train ride from Nanuoya to Ella
Nine-arch bridge and Adam’s Peak view

itinerary.description:
Nuwara Eliya is known for its cool climate, making it the coldest town in Sri Lanka.

Surrounded by lush tea estates and beautiful gardens, it is famous for Ceylon tea production. Visitors can tour tea plantations, witness the tea-making process, and enjoy tasting sessions.

Ella, located about 100 km southeast, has a milder climate and offers stunning natural beauty with green valleys, waterfalls, and scenic viewpoints.

itinerary.title: Ambuluwawa Tower & Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description:
Start the day by climbing Ambuluwawa Tower, a 48-meter structure with a spiral staircase offering spectacular views over the biosphere reserve.

Travel to Nuwara Eliya, passing through tea plantations and stopping at Devon and St. Clair waterfalls.

Visit the tea museum to learn about Ceylon tea production and its history.

Overnight stay at your hotel in Nuwara Eliya.

itinerary.title: Train Ride & Ella Exploration
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, board the train at Nanuoya Railway Station for a scenic journey to Ella, enjoying views of tea estates, waterfalls, and tunnels along the route.

In Ella, visit the famous Nine-Arch Bridge, climb a small peak for views of Adam, and explore the Ravana waterfall.

This excursion is ideal for nature enthusiasts and those interested in culture, history, and outdoor exploration.

name: Udawalawe & Ella
description: A 2-day tour combining wildlife experiences in Udawalawe and scenic highlands exploration in Ella, including waterfalls, viewpoints, and tea plantations.
highlights: Nine Arch Bridge and Little Adam’s Peak
Scenic train journey from Demodara to Haputale

itinerary.description:
Udawalawe is renowned for its natural beauty and wildlife, especially the elephants that roam freely in the Udawalawe National Park.

Embark on jeep safaris to see elephants, buffalo, deer, crocodiles, and various birds against the backdrop of rolling hills and water reservoirs.

Ella, a charming town in the central highlands, offers breathtaking viewpoints like the Ella Gap, scenic hiking trails to Ella Rock and Little Adam’s Peak, and cultural highlights such as the Nine Arch Bridge and local tea factories.

itinerary.title: Udawalawe Safari & Ella Highlights
itinerary.description:
Start the day with a morning safari in Udawalawe National Park to observe elephants and other wildlife.

Travel towards Ella, stopping at Buduruwagala Temple and the legendary Ravana waterfall.

Visit the iconic Nine Arch Bridge and climb Little Adam’s Peak for panoramic views of the surrounding hills.

Overnight stay at your hotel in Ella.

itinerary.title: Train Journey & Haputale Exploration
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, board the train at Demodara Station for a scenic journey to Haputale, passing the Nine Arch Bridge and enjoying stunning hill country vistas.

In Haputale, visit the former English estate and current Adisham Monastery of the Brotherhood of St. Benedict.

Conclude the day with a visit to Diyaluma Waterfall before returning to your hotel.

name: Udawalawe Baby Elephants, Haputale & Nuwara Eliya
description: A 2-day wildlife and highlands adventure featuring Udawalawe baby elephants, scenic train rides, Haputale vistas, tea plantations, and waterfalls.
location: Udawalawe, Haputale & Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka
highlights: Nuwara Eliya historic town and tea factory

itinerary.description:
Udawalawe National Park is home to a large population of elephants, including adorable baby elephants that thrive in a safe environment.

Visitors can observe young elephants playing, feeding, and learning from their elders. The park’s diverse landscapes of grasslands, marshes, and reservoirs provide ideal habitats for these majestic creatures.

Haputale, perched high in the central highlands, offers stunning vistas, cool climates, and rolling tea plantations, making it perfect for nature lovers.

Nuwara Eliya, the tea capital of Sri Lanka, features lush gardens, colonial architecture, and world-famous Ceylon tea, which visitors can sample at local factories.

itinerary.title: Udawalawe Baby Elephants & Haputale
itinerary.description:
Start the day at the Udawalawe baby elephant nursery, where young elephants left without parental care are nurtured for five years before being released into the wild. Observe feeding sessions and learn about the conservation process.

Travel towards Ella, stopping at Ravana Waterfall, shrouded in ancient legends.

Visit the iconic Nine Arch Bridge and climb Little Adam’s Peak for panoramic views.

Continue to Haputale and check in at your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Haputale & Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, visit the former estate of an English planter, now the Adisham Monastery of the Brotherhood of St. Benedict.

Board the train at Haputale Station for a scenic ride to Nanuoya, passing picturesque hills and tea plantations along one of the world’s most beautiful railway routes.

Arrive in Nuwara Eliya, exploring its historic post office, colonial-era mansions, and the Grand Hotel.

Visit a traditional tea factory to witness tea production and enjoy tastings. End the day with a stop at Ramboda Waterfall before returning to your hotel.

name: Sigiriya, Dambulla & Minneriya Safari
description: A 2-day cultural and wildlife tour exploring Sigiriya or Pidurangala, Dambulla’s golden cave temples, Minneriya National Park, and local tea and spice estates.

itinerary.description:
Sigiriya, known as the Lion Rock, is an iconic UNESCO World Heritage Site in central Sri Lanka.

Its sheer rock walls feature ancient frescoes and the remains of a royal palace at the summit, including the famous Lion’s Paw Terrace. Dambulla, another UNESCO site, is famous for its golden cave temples, adorned with intricate murals and numerous Buddha statues.

Minneriya National Park is a wildlife sanctuary best known for the ‘Gathering of Elephants,’ where hundreds of elephants congregate around the Minneriya Tank during the dry season. The park is also home to leopards, bears, crocodiles, and a variety of birds.

itinerary.title: Kurunegala & Sigiriya/Pidurangala
itinerary.description:
Begin the tour in Kurunegala, once a capital of the Sinhalese kingdom, and visit Etagala Mountain to see the giant white Buddha statue and enjoy panoramic views.

Proceed to Mount Pidurangala, a Buddhist monastery offering spectacular views of Lion Rock. Explore the temple, see a replica of the Sigiriya frescoes, ancient monastic cells, and a 15-meter Buddha statue from the 10th century.

Optional: climb Sigiriya instead of Pidurangala for an additional fee.

Overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Minneriya Safari & Dambulla
itinerary.description:
Start the day with a 3-hour jeep safari in Minneriya National Park, observing elephants and other wildlife in their natural habitats.

On the way back, visit the Dambulla Golden Temple, home to one of the largest Buddha statues in Sri Lanka.

Continue to a local spice and Ayurveda garden to learn about traditional medicinal plants and enjoy aromatic teas.

Finish with a visit to a working tea factory to see the stages of Ceylon tea production, taste different varieties, and optionally purchase tea directly from the producer.

name: Ella, Nuwara Eliya and Kandy
description: A scenic 3-day tour through mountain viewpoints, iconic train rides, tea plantations, cultural sites, and Sri Lanka’s most sacred Buddhist temple.
location: Ella, Nuwara Eliya & Kandy, Sri Lanka
highlights: Scenic train ride via nine-arch bridge
Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic

itinerary.description:
Ella is a scenic town at 1,041 meters above sea level with mild temperatures ranging from 15°C to 28°C, ideal for hiking and exploration.

Known for green valleys, waterfalls, and iconic viewpoints, Ella Rock and the famous Ella Gap provide breathtaking panoramas.

Nuwara Eliya, the coolest region in Sri Lanka (10°C to 20°C), is surrounded by lush tea estates and colonial architecture, and serves as the country’s tea cultivation center.

Kandy, the last royal capital, is a historic city famous for the sacred Temple of the Tooth and its cultural heritage.

itinerary.title: Ella Highlights & Viewpoints
itinerary.description:
Visit the legendary Ravana Waterfall, followed by the iconic nine-arch bridge built during the British colonial era.

Climb Little Adam’s Peak and enjoy panoramic views of lush mountain ranges.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Scenic Train Ride & Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, depart to Demodara Railway Station to board one of the most scenic train rides in the world.

The journey passes over the nine-arch bridge and through historic tunnels, showcasing waterfalls and endless tea plantations.

Arrive in Nuwara Eliya and visit the island’s oldest post office and the former governor’s residence, now the Grand Hotel.

Continue to one of the oldest tea factories to experience tea production and tasting.

Visit the 107-meter Ramboda Waterfall.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Kandy – Sacred Temple & Royal Gardens
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, visit Sri Dalada Maligawa, the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, one of the most revered Buddhist pilgrimage sites in the world.

Proceed to the Royal Botanical Gardens, featuring an extensive collection of tropical plants, palm tree avenues, an orchid greenhouse, and memorial trees planted by world figures including Yuri Gagarin and Tsar Nicholas II.

Visit Pinnawala, the largest elephant nursery in Asia, and stop at an Ayurvedic garden to learn about local medicinal plants.

This tour is ideal for nature, culture, history, and wildlife lovers.

name: Sigiriya, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya and Ella
description: A 3-day journey exploring ancient rock fortresses, sacred temples, misty tea hills, scenic train towns, waterfalls, and unforgettable viewpoints of Sri Lanka’s hill country.
location: Sigiriya, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya & Ella, Sri Lanka
highlights: Sri Maha Mari Amman Hindu Temple
Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic

itinerary.description:
Sigiriya, the famous Lion Rock, is a UNESCO World Heritage fortress rising dramatically from flat plains, known for ancient frescoes, palace ruins, and the iconic Lion’s Paw entrance.

Kandy, the cultural heart of Sri Lanka, is home to the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic, one of the most revered pilgrimage sites in the Buddhist world.

Nuwara Eliya, known as Little England, is famous for cool climate, colonial charm, tea plantations, and high-altitude botanical gardens.

Ella, a laid-back hill town, is known for adventure hikes, lush landscapes, Nine Arch Bridge, and breathtaking viewpoints.

itinerary.title: Pidurangala / Sigiriya – Dambulla – Matale – Kandy
itinerary.description:
Begin with a climb to Pidurangala Rock.

If you wish, you can climb Sigiriya instead of Pidurangala by paying the difference in ticket prices ($25 per adult and $10 per child 5–11 years old).

On the way to Kandy, visit the modern Golden Buddha Temple in Dambulla, featuring a 30-meter Buddha statue.

Continue to Matale to visit Sri Maha Mari Amman Temple, one of the largest Hindu temples in Sri Lanka, dedicated to the goddess of fertility and protection.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Kandy – Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, visit Sri Dalada Maligawa (Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic), one of the world’s most sacred Buddhist pilgrimage sites.

Proceed to the hill capital of tea — Nuwara Eliya, founded by British colonists in the 19th century and known for colonial architecture.

Visit the iconic 1894 post office, still functioning today.

Take a scenic walk through Hakgala Botanical Garden, one of the highest botanical gardens in the world (1,750 m above sea level), home to giant ferns, roses, orchids, and rare flowers.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Ella – Waterfalls, Bridge & Mountain Views
itinerary.description:
Travel to the famous hill town of Ella.

Visit the legendary Ravana Falls, steeped in ancient folklore.

Explore the 100-year-old Nine Arch Bridge built during the British era.

Climb Little Adam’s Peak for spectacular panoramic views over green mountain ridges.

This excursion is ideal for nature lovers, adventurers, and travelers interested in culture, wildlife, history, archeology, and religion.

name: Ella, Nuwara Eliya with Train Ride
description: A 3-day hill country experience featuring Ella viewpoints, waterfalls, tea highlands, and one of the world’s most scenic train journeys to Nuwara Eliya.
highlights: Scenic train ride from Ella to Nanuoya

itinerary.description:
Ella is a charming mountain town surrounded by tea estates and hiking trails. Landmarks like Ella Rock and Little Adam’s Peak reveal sweeping green landscapes.

The Nine Arch Bridge is a famous landmark where trains roll through lush jungle scenery, creating a picture-perfect setting.

Nuwara Eliya, known as 'Little England', is famous for its cool climate, colonial charm, flower gardens, and emerald tea fields. The town offers a refreshing highland escape with a nostalgic atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Ella Highlights
itinerary.description:
Explore Ella’s most iconic attractions, including the legendary Ravana Waterfall and the century-old Nine Arch Bridge.

Climb Little Adam’s Peak for wide panoramic views over green mountain ranges.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Scenic Train Ride to Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, board the train at Ella Railway Station for one of the world’s most scenic rail journeys, known for its dramatic landscapes and viewpoint-worthy windows.

Arrive at Nanuoya Station and continue to Nuwara Eliya, a highland town with timeless colonial character.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Nuwara Eliya & Viewpoints
itinerary.description:
Begin the day at Sri Lanka’s oldest functioning post office, a charming colonial building perfect for sending postcards.

Next, climb the 48-meter Ambuluwawa Tower, recognized for its outer spiral staircase and breathtaking 360-degree views.

Enjoy sights of St. Clair Waterfall, one of the island’s most beautiful cascades.

Visit the Mlesna Tea Center and Museum featuring scenic terraces, a tea boutique, and stunning views over lush tea landscapes and distant Devon Falls.

name: Dambulla, Minneriya and Kandy
description: A 3-day cultural and wildlife tour featuring ancient cave temples, a safari experience, elephant encounters, and Sri Lanka’s sacred hill capital, Kandy.
highlights: Peradeniya Botanical Garden or Ambuluwawa Tower (optional)

itinerary.description:
Dambulla is home to the Golden Cave Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site filled with ancient statues, murals, and artwork carved inside massive rock caves dating back over 2,000 years.

Minneriya National Park is famous for the 'Gathering of the Elephants,' where large herds meet near the Minneriya reservoir during the dry season.

Kandy, the last royal capital, is a cultural gem known for sacred sites, history, and scenic surroundings.

itinerary.title: Pinnawala & Dambulla
itinerary.description:
Start the journey with a visit to Asia’s largest elephant nursery, Pinnawala.

Continue to the legendary Dambulla Cave Temple, home to ancient frescoes and statues depicting the life and journey of Buddha.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Rock Fortress & Minneriya Safari
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, climb one of two iconic sites of your choice: Pidurangala Rock (included) or Sigiriya Rock (+$25 per person fee applies if chosen).

Then enjoy an exciting safari in Minneriya National Park, home to elephants, leopards, buffaloes, deer, crocodiles, and diverse birdlife.

Optional alternative to safari: Village experience including a bullock cart ride, lake boat ride, village lifestyle interaction, and authentic Sri Lankan meal.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Kandy Cultural Experience
itinerary.description:
Visit the Temple of the Tooth Relic, one of the most sacred Buddhist pilgrimage sites.

Explore an Ayurvedic herbal garden and a working tea factory.

Choose between two optional attractions: the Royal Botanical Gardens of Peradeniya or the 48-meter Ambuluwawa Tower, known for its spiral staircase and panoramic hill views.

This tour is ideal for nature lovers, wildlife enthusiasts, and those interested in culture, history, and religion.

name: Kandy, Matale, Pinnawala and Knuckles Mountain Range
description: A 3-day cultural, wildlife and nature adventure featuring Sri Lanka’s hill capital, sacred temples, elephant experiences, spice lands and the scenic Knuckles mountains.
location: Kandy, Matale, Pinnawala & Knuckles, Sri Lanka
highlights: Knuckles Mountain Range trek or viewpoints

itinerary.description:
Kandy is the cultural heart of Sri Lanka, home to the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic.

Matale is famous for spice cultivation and natural charm.

Pinnawala is renowned for its elephant orphanage, allowing close interaction and observation.

The Knuckles Mountain Range is a UNESCO-protected biodiversity hotspot offering misty peaks, forests, waterfalls and breathtaking trekking routes.

itinerary.title: Tea Factory, Pinnawala, Gardens & Sacred Temple
itinerary.description:
Begin with a visit to an authentic Ceylon tea factory to experience the production process.

Visit Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, the largest elephant sanctuary in Asia.

Stop at an Ayurvedic spice garden to learn about local herbs and healing traditions.

Explore the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya, featuring orchids, royal palms, and memorial trees planted by global figures.

End the day at Sri Dalada Maligawa, the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Matale Temple & Knuckles Mountain Exploration
itinerary.description:
After breakfast, visit Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in Matale, dedicated to the goddess of health and fertility.

Continue to the breathtaking Knuckles Mountain Range.

Choose between a scenic walk around Sembuwatta Lake, surrounded by tea land, pines and eucalyptus, or a climb to Riverstone Ridge for panoramic views at 1500m above sea level.

Overnight at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Kadadora Temple Ruins & Ambuluwawa Tower
itinerary.description:
Visit the mysterious Kadadora Temple ruins, visible only when reservoir water levels are low, often compared to the lost city of Atlantis.

Finish the tour at the 48-meter Ambuluwawa Tower, famous for its spiral staircase and 360° panoramic views across the region.

name: Sinharaja Rainforest & Eco Tour 03 Days 02 Nights
description: Discover the wonders of Sri Lanka’s UNESCO-listed Sinharaja Rainforest with a 3-day eco-tour. Explore endemic wildlife, lush tropical flora, waterfalls, and enjoy guided nature walks. The tour includes hotel stays, expert guides, transport, insurance, and breakfast.
location: Colombo, Sinharaja Rainforest, Galle, Sri Lanka
highlights: Scenic drives through Sri Lanka’s southwest wet zone
Village visits and cultural experiences near the rainforest

itinerary.description: Experience Sri Lanka’s biodiversity and pristine rainforest on a 3-day eco-tour to the Sinharaja Rainforest, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, featuring endemic birds, mammals, and rich tropical flora.

itinerary.title: Arrival – Colombo – Sinharaja
itinerary.description: Arrive at Bandaranaike International Airport and meet your Lanka Heaven Tours chauffeur. Drive to Sinharaja Rainforest, passing scenic southwestern landscapes. Check in at your eco-lodge or hotel near the rainforest. Enjoy a short evening nature walk and an introduction to the rainforest ecosystem.

itinerary.title: Full Day Sinharaja Rainforest Trek
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day guided trek into the Sinharaja Rainforest. Spot endemic bird species, butterflies, monkeys, and unique flora. Visit waterfalls and natural pools for relaxation and photography. Enjoy an eco-lunch in the heart of the forest and learn about the conservation efforts protecting this UNESCO World Heritage Site. Return to your lodge for dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Sinharaja – Galle / Colombo – Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast, take a final short morning walk through the forest or nearby village. Check out from your lodge and transfer via scenic route to Galle or Colombo. Stop at viewpoints or local villages along the way. Arrive at the airport or your hotel in Colombo for departure with memories of Sri Lanka’s rainforest adventure.

name: 05 Days 04 Nights
description: A 5-day coastal and cultural round tour of Sri Lanka, offering scenic beaches, river safaris, heritage sites, whale watching, and city exploration with smooth airport transfers and guided sightseeing.
location: Colombo, Bentota, Galle, Mirissa, Negombo, Sri Lanka

itinerary.description: When your flight arrives at Colombo International Airport, a chauffeur or guide from Lanka Heave Tours will meet and welcome you. After clearing the airport, you will be transferred to Colombo, which takes roughly 40 minutes. Colombo, the commercial capital of Sri Lanka, is also a top destination for travelers, offering city landmarks, beachfront views, and a thriving business district including the famous Fort area.

itinerary.title: Arrival (CMB) - Colombo
itinerary.description: After hotel check-in, your guide will take you on a city tour. Highlights include the National Museum of Colombo, Lotus Tower, and Gangarama Temple. The museum showcases ancient Sri Lankan statues, as well as the former King’s golden throne and crown. The Lotus Tower, named for its lotus-inspired design, is the second tallest structure in South Asia and features observation and leisure facilities. At Gangarama Temple, you can see a collection of Buddha statues and sacred relics, including believed strands of Buddha’s hair. Overnight stay in Colombo.

itinerary.title: Colombo – Bentota – Galle
itinerary.description: After breakfast, depart to Galle. En route, stop at Bentota Beach. Visit a turtle hatchery, where you may hold baby turtles. Enjoy a scenic Madu River safari surrounded by rich mangroves and diverse wildlife. Continue to Galle, arriving in around 1 hour 40 minutes. After resort check-in, explore Galle’s key attractions, including the National Maritime Museum, Galle Fort, and its iconic Lighthouse, built in 1954, surrounded by historic cannons and ocean views. Overnight stay in Galle.

itinerary.title: Galle – Mirissa
itinerary.description: After breakfast, head to Mirissa (approx. 1 hour). Stop at Unawatuna Beach, known for its turquoise waters, palm coastline, and a rock-top Buddha statue offering panoramic views. Continue to Mirissa, a coastal town famous worldwide for blue whale sightings. Relax on the beach and enjoy the calm seaside atmosphere. Overnight stay in Mirissa.

itinerary.title: Mirissa – Negombo
itinerary.description: Early morning whale-watching excursion. Afterward, drive to Negombo (approx. 3 hours). This coastal town, often called 'Little Rome,' is known for colonial churches, local markets, Dutch Fort, fishing culture, and sandy beaches. Visit St. Mary’s Church, one of the city’s most notable landmarks. In the afternoon, explore the city and relax at the beach. Overnight stay in Negombo.

itinerary.title: Negombo – Departure
itinerary.description: Enjoy breakfast and relax until it is time for airport transfer. You will be dropped off at the airport in time for your departure, concluding your journey with unforgettable memories of Sri Lanka.

Madu River boat safari & Bentota turtle hatchery

itinerary.description: This 6-day Sri Lanka journey begins and concludes at Colombo Airport, guiding you through Kandy and several other remarkable destinations across the island. The tour includes hotel stays, an experienced driver, required insurance, breakfast meals, transportation, and more, delivering a smooth and memorable travel experience.

itinerary.title: Arrival (CMB) – Pinnawala – Kandy
itinerary.description: Upon landing, you will be warmly greeted by our tour chauffeur and driven towards Kandy. On the way, stop at Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage to observe the bathing and milk feeding of baby elephants. Later, enjoy a city tour in Kandy including a visit to the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Dalada Maligawa), one of the most revered Buddhist sites, which shelters the sacred Buddha tooth relic. In the evening, witness a traditional cultural dance performance. Overnight in Kandy.

itinerary.title: Kandy – Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description: After breakfast, explore the Royal Botanical Garden in Peradeniya. Continue to Peradeniya Railway Station to board a scenic train journey through misty tea estates toward Nuwara Eliya. Your chauffeur will greet you at Nanuoya Station. Later, enjoy time around Gregory Lake with a relaxing lakeside walk in the cool climate. Overnight in Nuwara Eliya.

itinerary.title: Nuwara Eliya – Horton Plains – Ella
itinerary.description: Start early with a packed breakfast and travel to Horton Plains National Park for a short trek to World’s End and Bakers Falls. After the hike, return to the hotel for a brief rest before heading to Ella. En route, admire scenic waterfalls and tea plantations. Later, visit the iconic Nine Arch Bridge in Ella. Evening at leisure. Overnight in Ella.

itinerary.title: Ella – Udawalawe – Mirissa
itinerary.description: Begin the day with a trek to Little Adam’s Peak. Afterward, travel toward Mirissa, stopping at Udawalawe National Park. From 3:00 PM to 6:00 PM, enjoy a 4x4 jeep safari to spot wild elephants and other animals in their natural habitat. After the safari, continue to Mirissa and check into the hotel. Overnight in Mirissa.

itinerary.title: Mirissa – Bentota – Colombo
itinerary.description: Early morning whale watching excursion from Mirissa Beach. After the boat tour, begin the drive toward Colombo with stops at the Bentota turtle hatchery and the Madu River for a scenic boat safari among mangroves and island landscapes. Arrive in Colombo in the evening, check into the hotel, and enjoy the city nightlife. Overnight in Colombo.

itinerary.title: Colombo – Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast, explore Colombo city including the National Museum, Gangarama Temple, and other notable attractions. At the end of the tour, transfer to the airport in time for your departure flight.

itinerary.title: Yala – Mirissa
itinerary.description: After breakfast, depart for Mirissa (approx. 3.5-hour drive). In the afternoon, visit Coconut Tree Hill and Parrot Rock Bridge before spending leisure time along the popular Mirissa Beach. Enjoy the coastal atmosphere and a seafood dinner by the shore. Overnight in Mirissa.

itinerary.title: Mirissa – Galle
itinerary.description: Start early with a whale watching boat excursion from Mirissa. After the tour, continue to Galle to explore the historic Galle Fort, National Maritime Museum, and the iconic Galle Lighthouse. Check into your hotel in the evening. Overnight in Galle.

itinerary.title: Galle – Colombo – Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast, return to Colombo or Negombo. Based on your flight schedule, your driver will transfer you to the airport for departure.

itinerary.title: Kandy – Knuckles Mountain Range – Kandy
itinerary.description: Travel to the Knuckles Mountain Range, a strict nature reserve with rare endemic plants and unique biodiversity. Explore the highland terrain before returning to Kandy for the night.

itinerary.title: Kandy – Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description: Proceed to Nuwara Eliya, a scenic hill country town. Tour tea plantations, golf courses, Hakgala Botanical Garden, Hindu temples, and the Pink Post Office. Evening leisure activities at Gregory Lake including water sports.

itinerary.title: Nuwara Eliya – Horton Plains – Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description: Early morning visit to Horton Plains National Park with a breakfast pack. Hike to World’s End and Baker’s Falls, observing endemic wildlife such as Sambhur, leopards, and bear monkeys. Visit a New Zealand-style farm in Ambewela. Evening shopping in Nuwara Eliya town.

itinerary.title: Nuwara Eliya – Udawalawe National Park
itinerary.description: Travel to Udawalawe National Park. Enjoy an afternoon ½-day safari spotting elephants, deer, langurs, jackals, water birds, and peacocks in their natural habitat. Overnight stay near the park.

itinerary.title: Udawalawe National Park – Colombo / Airport
itinerary.description: Early morning wildlife jeep safari for bird watching and elephant spotting. After the safari, transfer to Colombo city or Bandaranaike International Airport for your departure.
